oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Pentacene organic field effect transistors on flexible substrates with polymer dielectrics
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: TIWARI, SP
RAMGOPAL RAO, V
HUEI SHAUN TAN
NAMDAS, EB
MHAISALKAR, SG
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: aluminium
dielectric materials
electron mobility
field effect transistors
indium compounds
organic semiconductors
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pentacene organic field effect transistors are fabricated using polymethyl methacrylate (PMMA) as a gate dielectric on flexible polymeric substrates like the indium tin oxide coated polyethylene terephthalate (ITO coated PET), and polyethylene napthalate (PEN) in top contact configuration. The ITO and aluminium (evaporated on PEN) act as the gate materials for the OFETs. The devices on ITO coated PET show electron mobility up to 0.07 cm2/V-s and the on/off ratios in the order of 103.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Proceedings of the International Symposium on VLSI Technology, Systems and Applications, Hsinchu, China, 23-25 April 2007, 1-2
